title: godofodium
author: godofodium
created_time: April 08, 2023, 04:43:39 PMLast edit: April 08, 2023, 04:54:44 PM by godofodium
content: Folks help.I run a healthy node but not able to understand why my node is not visible.(https://bitnodes.io/nodes/all/#global-bitcoin-nodes)I run clear on IPv4/v6/tor/i2p all pf themI get the message" Â xx.xxx.xxx.xxx:xxxx is unreachable."My onion route is reachable

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Check your peers using the command: getpeerinfoSeed if all of them are "outgoing" by checking the line "inbound": false/true of each peer.In the GUI, it in your "Window->Peers".If all are outgoing, your node isn't reachable.Follow this guide to configure your network and node for inbound connections: https://bitcoin.org/en/full-node#enabling-connections

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Make sure that you haven't banned the bitnodes crawlers by accident.Remove them from your banlist using these commands:bitcoin-cli setban 88.99.167.175/32 removebitcoin-cli setban 88.99.167.186/32 removebitcoin-cli setban 2a01:4f8:10a:37ee::2/128 removeYou might also find this thread helpful: My node is not reachable from Bitnodes, other wallets: maxed out incoming peers?
